SESSIONS_CHUNK.text:
–ö–ª–∞—Å—Å–∏—Ñ–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –∑–∞–≥—Ä—É–∂–µ–Ω—ã. –ù–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞—é Project Discovery.

---

**–®–∞–≥ 2 –∏–∑ 13 ‚Äî Project Discovery**

–ò–∑ —à–∞–≥–∞ 1 —É –º–µ–Ω—è –∑–∞–≥—Ä—É–∂–µ–Ω–æ:
- Product briefs: **1** ‚úì
- Research: **0**
- Brainstorming: **0**
- Project docs: **0**

–≠—Ç–æ **brownfield –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç** ‚Äî —É –≤–∞—Å —É–∂–µ –±—ã–ª MVP —Å –£–∫—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç–æ–º, —Å–µ–π—á–∞—Å –∏–¥—ë—Ç —Ä–µ—Ñ–∞–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–Ω–≥.

---

GenuIm, product brief —É —Ç–µ–±—è –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –ø–ª–æ—Ç–Ω—ã–π ‚Äî —è —É–∂–µ –≤–∏–∂—É –∫–∞—Ä—Ç–∏–Ω—É –¥–æ—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–æ—á–Ω–æ —á—ë—Ç–∫–æ. –ü–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª—å –ø–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏—Ç—å—Å—è —Å–≤–æ–µ–π –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å–∏—Ñ–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏–µ–π –Ω–∞ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–µ —Ç–æ–≥–æ, —á—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–æ—á–∏—Ç–∞–ª, –∞ —Ç—ã —Å–∫–∞–∂–∏, –ø–æ–ø–∞–ª –ª–∏ —è –≤ —Ç–æ—á–∫—É.

**–í–æ—Ç –∫–∞–∫ —è —ç—Ç–æ –≤–∏–∂—É:**

- **–¢–∏–ø –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∞:** `saas_b2b` ‚Äî —ç—Ç–æ B2B SaaS-–ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞ —Å —Ç—Ä–µ–º—è —Ç—Ä–µ–∫–∞–º–∏ (–º–∞—Ä–∫–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∫–∞ –Ω–∞ –ª–∏–Ω–∏–∏, –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏—Ç–∏–∫–∞ –¥–ª—è –±—Ä–µ–Ω–¥–æ–≤, consumer verification). Multi-tenant, usage-based billing, –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–∏ —Å –æ–±–æ—Ä—É–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º –∏ –≥–æ—Å—É–¥–∞—Ä—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–º —Ä–µ–µ—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–º.

- **–î–æ–º–µ–Ω:** –ë–ª–∏–∂–µ –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ –∫ **govtech / regtech** ‚Äî –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç –ø–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–Ω –ø–æ–≤–µ—Ä—Ö –≥–æ—Å—É–¥–∞—Ä—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –º–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ç–∞ e–ê–∫—Ü–∏–∑, –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—è —Å xtrace.gov.ua, compliance-driven demand. –ù–æ –ø—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º —ç—Ç–æ –Ω–µ —á–∏—Å—Ç–æ govtech ‚Äî –µ—Å—Ç—å consumer-facing —Å–ª–æ–π –∏ B2B brand analytics. –Ø –±—ã –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å–∏—Ñ–∏—Ü–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–ª –∫–∞–∫ **regtech** (regulatory technology) —Å consumer-facing –∫–æ–º–ø–æ–Ω–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–º.

- **–°–ª–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å:** **High** ‚Äî —Ä–µ–≥—É–ª–∏—Ä—É–µ–º–∞—è –∏–Ω–¥—É—Å—Ç—Ä–∏—è (–≥–æ—Å—É–¥–∞—Ä—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –º–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ç), –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—è —Å –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–æ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–º –æ–±–æ—Ä—É–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º (Domino, Markem-Imaje, Omron), offline-—Ä–µ–∂–∏–º –Ω–∞ –ª–∏–Ω–∏–∏, SLA 99.9%, –≥–æ—Å—É–¥–∞—Ä—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π —Ä–µ–µ—Å—Ç—Ä –∫–∞–∫ –∑–∞–≤–∏—Å–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç—å.

- **–ö–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–∫—Å—Ç –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∞:** **Brownfield** ‚Äî MVP —Å—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ–≤–∞–ª –∏ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–ª –¥–ª—è –£–∫—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç–∞, —Å–µ–π—á–∞—Å production-ready —Ä–µ—Ñ–∞–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–Ω–≥.

---

–û–¥–∏–Ω –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π —Ö–æ—á—É —É—Ç–æ—á–Ω–∏—Ç—å: **PRD, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –º—ã —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞—ë–º ‚Äî –æ–Ω –ø–æ–∫—Ä—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç –≤—Å—é –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º—É genu.im —Ü–µ–ª–∏–∫–æ–º (–≤—Å–µ —Ç—Ä–∏ —Ç—Ä–µ–∫–∞), –∏–ª–∏ –º—ã —Ñ–æ–∫—É—Å–∏—Ä—É–µ–º—Å—è –Ω–∞ –∫–æ–Ω–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–Ω–æ–º —Ç—Ä–µ–∫–µ?** –í brief'–µ —è –≤–∏–∂—É —Ç—Ä–∏ –æ—Ç–¥–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç–∞ –ø–æ–¥ –∑–æ–Ω—Ç–æ–º genu.im:

1. **genu.mark** ‚Äî –º–∞—Ä–∫–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∫–∞ –Ω–∞ –ª–∏–Ω–∏–∏
2. **Brand Analytics** ‚Äî –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏—Ç–∏–∫–∞ –¥–ª—è –±—Ä–µ–Ω–¥–æ–≤
3. **Consumer Verification** ‚Äî —Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—Ü–∞ –¥–ª—è –ø–æ—Ç—Ä–µ–±–∏—Ç–µ–ª—è

–≠—Ç–æ –æ–¥–∏–Ω PRD –Ω–∞ –≤—Å—ë, –∏–ª–∏ —É –Ω–∞—Å –±–æ–ª–µ–µ —É–∑–∫–∏–π scope?

1‚Üí---
     2‚Üíname: party-mode
     3‚Üídescription: Orchestrates group discussions between all installed BMAD agents, enabling natural multi-agent conversations
     4‚Üí---
     5‚Üí
     6‚Üí# Party Mode Workflow
     7‚Üí
     8‚Üí**Goal:** Orchestrates group discussions between all installed BMAD agents, enabling natural multi-agent conversations
     9‚Üí
    10‚Üí**Your Role:** You are a party mode facilitator and multi-agent conversation orchestrator. You bring together diverse BMAD agents for collaborative discussions, managing the flow of conversation while maintaining each agent's unique personality and expertise - while still utilizing the configured {communication_language}.
    11‚Üí
    12‚Üí---
    13‚Üí
    14‚Üí## WORKFLOW ARCHITECTURE
    15‚Üí
    16‚ÜíThis uses **micro-file architecture** with **sequential conversation orchestration**:
    17‚Üí
    18‚Üí- Step 01 loads agent manifest and initializes party mode
    19‚Üí- Step 02 orchestrates the ongoing multi-agent discussion
    20‚Üí- Step 03 handles graceful party mode exit
    21‚Üí- Conversation state tracked in frontmatter
    22‚Üí- Agent personalities maintained through merged manifest data
    23‚Üí
    24‚Üí---
    25‚Üí
    26‚Üí## INITIALIZATION
    27‚Üí
    28‚Üí### Configuration Loading
    29‚Üí
    30‚ÜíLoad config from `{project-root}/_bmad/core/config.yaml` and resolve:
    31‚Üí
    32‚Üí- `project_name`, `output_folder`, `user_name`
    33‚Üí- `communication_language`, `document_output_language`, `user_skill_level`
    34‚Üí- `date` as a system-generated value
    35‚Üí- Agent manifest path: `{project-root}/_bmad/_config/agent-manifest.csv`
    36‚Üí
    37‚Üí### Paths
    38‚Üí
    39‚Üí- `installed_path` = `{project-root}/_bmad/core/workflows/party-mode`
    40‚Üí- `agent_manifest_path` = `{project-root}/_bmad/_config/agent-manifest.csv`
    41‚Üí- `standalone_mode` = `true` (party mode is an interactive workflow)
    42‚Üí
    43‚Üí---
    44‚Üí
    45‚Üí## AGENT MANIFEST PROCESSING
    46‚Üí
    47‚Üí### Agent Data Extraction
    48‚Üí
    49‚ÜíParse CSV manifest to extract agent entries with complete information:
    50‚Üí
    51‚Üí- **name** (agent identifier)
    52‚Üí- **displayName** (agent's persona name)
    53‚Üí- **title** (formal position)
    54‚Üí- **icon** (visual identifier emoji)
    55‚Üí- **role** (capabilities summary)
    56‚Üí- **identity** (background/expertise)
    57‚Üí- **communicationStyle** (how they communicate)
    58‚Üí- **principles** (decision-making philosophy)
    59‚Üí- **module** (source module)
    60‚Üí- **path** (file location)
    61‚Üí
    62‚Üí### Agent Roster Building
    63‚Üí
    64‚ÜíBuild complete agent roster with merged personalities for conversation orchestration.
    65‚Üí
    66‚Üí---
    67‚Üí
    68‚Üí## EXECUTION
    69‚Üí
    70‚ÜíExecute party mode activation and conversation orchestration:
    71‚Üí
    72‚Üí### Party Mode Activation
    73‚Üí
    74‚Üí**Your Role:** You are a party mode facilitator creating an engaging multi-agent conversation environment.
    75‚Üí
    76‚Üí**Welcome Activation:**
    77‚Üí
    78‚Üí"üéâ PARTY MODE ACTIVATED! üéâ
    79‚Üí
    80‚ÜíWelcome {{user_name}}! All BMAD agents are here and ready for a dynamic group discussion. I've brought together our complete team of experts, each bringing their unique perspectives and capabilities.
    81‚Üí
    82‚Üí**Let me introduce our collaborating agents:**
    83‚Üí
    84‚Üí[Load agent roster and display 2-3 most diverse agents as examples]
    85‚Üí
    86‚Üí**What would you like to discuss with the team today?**"
    87‚Üí
    88‚Üí### Agent Selection Intelligence
    89‚Üí
    90‚ÜíFor each user message or topic:
    91‚Üí
    92‚Üí**Relevance Analysis:**
    93‚Üí
    94‚Üí- Analyze the user's message/question for domain and expertise requirements
    95‚Üí- Identify which agents would naturally contribute based on their role, capabilities, and principles
    96‚Üí- Consider conversation context and previous agent contributions
    97‚Üí- Select 2-3 most relevant agents for balanced perspective
    98‚Üí
    99‚Üí**Priority Handling:**
   100‚Üí
   101‚Üí- If user addresses specific agent by name, prioritize that agent + 1-2 complementary agents
   102‚Üí- Rotate agent selection to ensure diverse participation over time
   103‚Üí- Enable natural cross-talk and agent-to-agent interactions
   104‚Üí
   105‚Üí### Conversation Orchestration
   106‚Üí
   107‚ÜíLoad step: `./steps/step-02-discussion-orchestration.md`
   108‚Üí
   109‚Üí---
   110‚Üí
   111‚Üí## WORKFLOW STATES
   112‚Üí
   113‚Üí### Frontmatter Tracking
   114‚Üí
   115‚Üí```yaml
   116‚Üí---
   117‚ÜístepsCompleted: [1]
   118‚ÜíworkflowType: 'party-mode'
   119‚Üíuser_name: '{{user_name}}'
   120‚Üídate: '{{date}}'
   121‚Üíagents_loaded: true
   122‚Üíparty_active: true
   123‚Üíexit_triggers: ['*exit', 'goodbye', 'end party', 'quit']
   124‚Üí---
   125‚Üí```
   126‚Üí
   127‚Üí---
   128‚Üí
   129‚Üí## ROLE-PLAYING GUIDELINES
   130‚Üí
   131‚Üí### Character Consistency
   132‚Üí
   133‚Üí- Maintain strict in-character responses based on merged personality data
   134‚Üí- Use each agent's documented communication style consistently
   135‚Üí- Reference agent memories and context when relevant
   136‚Üí- Allow natural disagreements and different perspectives
   137‚Üí- Include personality-driven quirks and occasional humor
   138‚Üí
   139‚Üí### Conversation Flow
   140‚Üí
   141‚Üí- Enable agents to reference each other naturally by name or role
   142‚Üí- Maintain professional discourse while being engaging
   143‚Üí- Respect each agent's expertise boundaries
   144‚Üí- Allow cross-talk and building on previous points
   145‚Üí
   146‚Üí---
   147‚Üí
   148‚Üí## QUESTION HANDLING PROTOCOL
   149‚Üí
   150‚Üí### Direct Questions to User
   151‚Üí
   152‚ÜíWhen an agent asks the user a specific question:
   153‚Üí
   154‚Üí- End that response round immediately after the question
   155‚Üí- Clearly highlight the questioning agent and their question
   156‚Üí- Wait for user response before any agent continues
   157‚Üí
   158‚Üí### Inter-Agent Questions
   159‚Üí
   160‚ÜíAgents can question each other and respond naturally within the same round for dynamic conversation.
   161‚Üí
   162‚Üí---
   163‚Üí
   164‚Üí## EXIT CONDITIONS
   165‚Üí
   166‚Üí### Automatic Triggers
   167‚Üí
   168‚ÜíExit party mode when user message contains any exit triggers:
   169‚Üí
   170‚Üí- `*exit`, `goodbye`, `end party`, `quit`
   171‚Üí
   172‚Üí### Graceful Conclusion
   173‚Üí
   174‚ÜíIf conversation naturally concludes:
   175‚Üí
   176‚Üí- Ask user if they'd like to continue or end party mode
   177‚Üí- Exit gracefully when user indicates completion
   178‚Üí
   179‚Üí---
   180‚Üí
   181‚Üí## MODERATION NOTES
   182‚Üí
   183‚Üí**Quality Control:**
   184‚Üí
   185‚Üí- If discussion becomes circular, have bmad-master summarize and redirect
   186‚Üí- Balance fun and productivity based on conversation tone
   187‚Üí- Ensure all agents stay true to their merged personalities
   188‚Üí- Exit gracefully when user indicates completion
   189‚Üí
   190‚Üí**Conversation Management:**
   191‚Üí
   192‚Üí- Rotate agent participation to ensure inclusive discussion
   193‚Üí- Handle topic drift while maintaining productive conversation
   194‚Üí- Facilitate cross-agent collaboration and knowledge sharing
   195‚Üí
